website_summaries.verdict: A low-cost, stainless steel pet fountain with a few known drawbacks.
pros: Sleek design is available in six colors to complement the decor where it is placed
cons: Filter replacements are pricey and difficult to find

customer_reviews.title: 2 dead fountains in a row -- much better alternatives out there
customer_reviews.text: Received not one but two dead units (pump did nothing when plugged in) in a row. I gave up and bought another brand that uses better parts. This is especially upsetting to us because we bought this fountain after our dear cat almost died from a urinary blockage caused by a bladder stone. We just wanted to get him anything that could even remotely encourage him to drink more water, so we bought this fountain (twice).
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Dead in under a year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought March 25, 2016. The suction cups stopped working about 6 months in. Pump Died three days ago (March 15th, 2017) Difficult to clean. We don't have a dish washer so we would have to soak the metal in the sink for several minutes to get it clean. Had to use q-tips near the point to get in the tight spot. Reallly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: MassResTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and  light weight
customer_reviews.text: I love these fountains. I bought two of them for my cats. I like how quiet they are. I was really tired of hearing running water in my Apartment from the other fountain I used to have. Also the other fountain was ceramic and a bit heavy to clean. I like How these are light weight and very easy to clean. the motor in these are the same as in most so you have to disassemble them the same way to get the hair out. The filters also last a bit longer in these fountains compared to the previous one. Great purchase my cats went right to them the first night.
customer_reviews.author: K-Mann

customer_reviews.title: Really cool to purify water
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item to purify your fur baby's water. It's really cool because it works almost like a fountain and almost soothing. The set-up is easy but the clean up is a mess. You have to unplug the device, drain it, take off the top pass the plug through the bowl and you can finally clean it. I do recommend washing it every few weeks though depending how messy your pet is. I also recommend getting a few filters as you need to replace them like every 2 to 3 months to help purify the water. If the bowl isn't clean properly though it could plug the water pump that purifies the water and stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, cool looking pet fountain
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this fountain, I like it too! It’s set up is fairly simple, but cleaning it sucks. The fountain is typically pretty quiet (think white noise), but when there is trash in the pump it’s loud and annoying. Be sure to follow cleaning instructions because you actually have to essentially take the pump apart. Customer service was friendly and quick to resolve an issue I was having. Also know the filters need to be ran through water so you don’t freak out when your cats water turns grey(they contain charcoal). Hope this helps, buy one they are of good quality and look cool!
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Sterling Jr.

customer_reviews.title: a great pet fountain!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pet fountain for cats. My favorite so far. I've tried plastic and ceramic before, metal seems to be where it's at. The pump assembly is easy to get to and cleaning is much friendlier than previous tries. It rarely gets clogged and is sooo quiet - both the pump and the spalsh sound are minimal. My cat won't drink from the slide, so I wish the bowl area was a little larger for her, but overall this is a great buy to make sure your pet has healthy drinking water all the time.
customer_reviews.author: J & D Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Super silent and cleared up kitty chin acne
customer_reviews.text: My kitty had kitty chin acne and the vet said it was common when using plastic water fountains because the plastic can easily harbor bacteria if there is a scratch in the surface which then gets on the cat's chin when drinking. I switched to this fountain which is stainless steel and the acne cleared right up. Super quiet until the water level drops too low. I kinda wish it had a reservoir of some sort so I didn't have to fill it up so often but that is a minor quibble.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loved it for a day then adapter starting buzzing
customer_reviews.text: Just took it out of the box and the instructions weren't that great but it is super easy to put it together since there are 4 parts and the filter/plug. The cord looks to be about maybe 3 feet long or so. After initially plugging it in it is loud for about a minute or two while it starts up, then it is really quiet to where you can't even hear it. So far one of my cats really enjoys it, started drinking from the very top within a minute of me putting it together. UPDATE: The adapter part that plugs into the wall started buzzing loudly after the first day so returned it. :/
customer_reviews.author: PS$

customer_reviews.title: Rain drop fountain
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet fountain. It is easy to assemble and clean. My cats at first took no interest in it as it is so quiet (they prefer the drip drip drip from a sink). But over a couple of days, it’s being used a lot. Nice, sleek design. Would recommend this. Was gone for a few days and had peace of mind that the cats had clean drinking water. I rinse it out weekly, though it doesn’t necessarily look mucky.
customer_reviews.author: Farchimp

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this water fountain. It's looks great and is a simple design that's easy to clean. My dogs love water fountains, but wouldn't drink out of it. The drinking part of the bowl is too small and 2 or 3 inches below the top piece that serves as the water ramp. It's probably great for cats, but most dogs won't stick their head in a tight space. Also, when the water level drops 1/2 inch, the pump starts getting noisy. It's a great design, but these 2 issues unfortunately caused me to return it. I would recommend they make the ramp not so wide and open up the actual drinking area a bit.
customer_reviews.author: donhooksc

customer_reviews.title: Easy to maintain
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good things about this water fountain. My cat absolutely loves it. He would not drink still water. He use to be an outside cat. His habits were different from cats that are raised inside. Not he constantly drink from his fountain. The fountain itself is so easy to maintain. I’ve had it four months & it works great. Would recommend it to everyone. I would give it 10 stars.
customer_reviews.author: wendy berteau

customer_reviews.title: Mine have worked for several years.  Pump no trouble.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these and am going to purchase another one. I have had them for several years and no trouble. All pumps continue to work. Cats like &drink from them. Watch video about how to clean pump on U-Tube is helpful. Update, 1 pump bought in 2014, 2nd 2017. Still no trouble, but the cord on 1pump has little cracks. It still works fine but I had purchased another pump as a spare & think the cord can be taped and continue to use. Note for everyone: read the reviews and questions you will learn a lot about these pumps from many users.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Canale

customer_reviews.title: Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My Persian kitten loves this! It’s pretty easy to clean, just that the cord is too long or it needs to be disconnected closer to the fountain. Otherwise she loves it! It doesn’t spill all over. It’s just right. Revised review: love everything about this fountain but, after three days it becomes cloudy, filthy, full of thick bacteria bio film. Full of red spots all over, yuck! Today I decided to take filter out to see if better, I just added filtered water. This is why I am now changing this five star review to a three star ⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Liliana

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this fountain a while back, as my cat seems to have a preference for running water. I've had this a little over a year now, and so far so good. The fountain did shut off entirely about 10 months into having it. However, I took the time to disassemble the mechanism and soaked everything using a water and vinegar solution (I have hard water, and cleaning with water alone was not sufficient). It started right back up with improved performance. The Pioneer Pet website has useful videos on disassembly and cleaning if you ever run into this problem -- after watching the videos, I found the disassembly and assembly very easy. Beyond that, I haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Angela S.

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves this fountain
customer_reviews.text: MY cat must be a mutant, because in addition to vastly preferring the moving water to drink over a regular water dish, he also enjoys dropping small items inside it and splasihng after the toy with his paws. It runs very quietly unless the water gets too low, then it will make the standard 'air in the pump' noises which can get loud. If your fountain does run low and you refill it, the pump sometimes will continue growling until you unplug the unit for 10 seconds and plug it back in. This allows the water to fill the pump chamber and the air to be released from it, it will quiet down in less than 5 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer nerd

customer_reviews.title: My cats' favorite fountain
customer_reviews.text: I have a 17 lb cat and a 12 lb cat and they both love this fountain. They both like to drink from the fountain on the top and from the bowl. I also have the larger Pioneer Big Max 128 oz fountain which they still use but it seems this 60 oz fountain has become their favorite. From time to time I'll find one of them has even fallen asleep next to it! It's vitally important that cats drink enough water to stay healthy and having drinking fountains that are fun for them to drink out of makes the difference. Also cats are wary of stagnant water so if they see moving water they are more likely to drink.
customer_reviews.author: Artzy

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when buying this item. I bought this item in October and it is now the end of December and the water fountain is no longer working. I returned home to find that the water fountain was making a loud noise. When I approach closer I could smell a burning scent. I immediately unplugged from the wall outlet. After a few minutes I replugged the fountain and it did not work at all. I'm guessing the transformer and pump just stopped working. They do sell replacement pumps and transformers, but I don't want to take th risk especially with the burning scent I experience. Upset I spent $40+ on a fountain that lasted less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Zahra Ghit

customer_reviews.title: Cat's don't like it
customer_reviews.text: The opening for my cats to drink out of is not a large space (I can't imagine a dog bigger than a chihuahua liking it!). They don't like to stick their faces into the small opening as their whiskers hit the sides of the opening. It is just way too small. I wound up taking the cover part off of it and so it's just a bubbling bowl now. So overall it is a really expensive bubbling bowl.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Our Cats Love It
customer_reviews.text: At first, our cats were playing with the water but have since adjusted and love drinking from the fountain. Our one cat loves to watch me add water to it every night, then he starts drinking from it right away. One likes to drink where the water falls and the other from the opening. It is quieter than the last fountain we had and it is easy to clean all parts as well. The filter is easy to clean and should be changed every 2 to 4 (maximum) weeks and they are inexpensive on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful features but my cats did not like
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell, my two cats looked at this only once in about ten days, so I am giving up and sending it back. They do like the bottom if I remove the pump part and the top section and make a big bowl out of it, but it is rather expensive to make a large bowl. LOL The noise does not seem to bother them--they have never paid attention to it in any way. I suspect the problem is their whiskers touch the sides when they drink out of it. It is very quiet. Since it can go in dishwasher (which is why I got it), it should be easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: moderate user

customer_reviews.title: Best Fountain for Cats!!
customer_reviews.text: Cats never drink as much water as they should. I tried every fountain on the market and this is the only one that I didn’t return. My cats love to drink from the faucet in the bathroom and kitchen, almost exclusively. I see both of my cats drinking from this fountain several times a day. I highly recommend this product for cats and dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Denium jean Criswell

customer_reviews.title: Basically Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! I used to have a plastic fountain that after a few months, I felt like I could never get it completely clean. With the stainless steel, just some warm/hot soapy water and it ends up looking like new. I would definitely purchase again and recommend to a friend. Its actually quieter than my previous fountain and I have this one on a higher setting than the other. Once I showed my older male cat what it was, he started using it pretty much right away. He was skeptical at first, I think because its shiny and his old one was just black plastic. Once he figured it out, he's used it without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Erin - TN

customer_reviews.title: Too Short Life and it has only a 30-day warranty
customer_reviews.text: Purchased June 11, 2020; Return window closed on July 12, 2020; pump failed 9/28/2020. So, it holds a nice amount of water. The filter NEEDS to be changed every 7 to 10 days -- stock up on them. When the water gets low, it makes a HORRENDOUS high-pitched sucking sound (have that wake you up in the middle of the night!!). Today, the LV submersible pump failed, so my choice is to buy a new pump or return the extra filters I have and find a new fountain..
customer_reviews.author: sheoguey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! My cats love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I JUST got this fountain, but I’m already impressed! It was super simple to set up (and going to be much simpler than my old one to clean!!) and my cats already love it! One of my cats practically shoved me out of the way to get at it when I was setting on the floor, and my other cat was slightly more wary and sat and watched it for a bit before approaching. But it’s been on the floor for half an hour, and both of them have gone by it multiple times to watch the water and get a drink. I’ll update if there are any issues!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Good Once it's Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these for five years and finally decided to replace with new one. The new one had a deeper design, so much less splashing out of the bowl. Original motor was very noisy, second motor was noisy, third motor was better. Best solution if it is noisy is to install something like Dynamat on the bottom of the bowl. Quieted our motor down substantially. Don't forget to clean it regularly. Customer service was very helpful. Biggest compliant now is the outrageous highway robbery costs for replacement filters. I guess the off-brand option got sued, as they are no longer available on Amazon and the name brand ones are 4X the price.
customer_reviews.author: GuruJon

customer_reviews.title: A not bad fountain
customer_reviews.text: this is a very quiet fountain. The pump makes almost no noise and seems to have good pressure. But the stainless steel is a bit cheap and after having it for 2 months a lot of deposit has built up on the top of the fountain and in the bowl area. I do use bottled spring water but even with a brillo pad the deposit won't come off. A good fountain otherwise, easy to assemble, cats love it but will probably replace with a ceramic fountain when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and easy to care for water fountain!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using water fountains for my cats for over a decade. The previous one was very large, but particularly difficult to clean. This is much smaller so it has to be filled frequently (I now have one cat and I probably add water every three days or so). It's cleaning, however, only requires about 5 minutes and I can have it soaped, scrubbed, rinsed, refilled, and running again. When I refill it after three days I dump the contents, rinse it, and refill it so he constantly has fresh water. I am very happy with this purchase and highly recommend for people with a single cat, or two if you fill it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Danea55

customer_reviews.title: Love that it’s silent! Trying to train older cats to fountains
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had luck getting my older cats to take to a fountain and this is the second one I’ve bought. I received it a week ago, the 1st one I purchased was a ceramic Petsafe Drinkwell Pagota and it’s beautiful but very loud. This stainless steel fountain is still aesthetically pleasing (ceramic “looks” better in my opinion but I think causes the louder trickle sound) but this one is literally silent so I’m hoping I’ll have more luck getting my cats to take to it. I’ll update, after a few days, if I have any success or find any issues.
customer_reviews.author: JamieD

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats that love to drink only water in motion!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to deter our kitty from trying to drink out of faucets. Took a little training, we positioned the bowl near our cats favorite watering hole, the kitchen sink. Every time she’d go for the faucet, we would reposition her to the Drinking Fountain. Only took 3 days, but now kitty goes to the Fountain every time, and is getting more water in her body; very important since we live in a fairly dry climate. Noticed the litter box had bigger pee clumps too. The Fountain is quiet and takes up little space, Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Will's Mom

customer_reviews.title: The pump dies quickly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it 2 months ago and I already changed 2 pumps and both died and didn't work about a month. I followed the instruction to clean the pump but it still didn't work. So I took it to a friend who knows about electronics and he told me the pump quality is no good... i'm very disappointed as my previous pet fountain which is Drinkwell worked for 3 years and this one only worked for less than a month with a new pump...........
customer_reviews.author: Wis Au

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how this fountain could be better
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this fountain for over 5 years of continual use. I am only visiting this product now because for the FIRST time I need to replace the pump and looking for the correct one. My cats absolutely love this fountain. For those complaining about slimy water, you realize you can with absolute minimal effort change the water once a week and change the filter once a month (or less often for me). Not sure how this fountain could be better or easier to maintain. Very highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JaniKin

customer_reviews.title: Toe beans seal of approval!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always given my cats fresh water in a stainless steel bowl. However my boy, Murdock would always look for fresh water in the house from the shower or sink. Now I'm not seeing him do that! It makes me feel better as a pet parent that he is finally getting what he needs! I have had the fountain about a month, no issues. Worth the price. Also great to read other customers comments, advice. I have had one fountain before. A plastic one. This is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Obrigewitsch

customer_reviews.title: Great fountain!
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these fountains we owned lasted about 7 years. We only replaced it because the white plastic clam shell piece inside had started to become out of shape from opening it to clean. This fountain is quiet, we think it looks good and our 3 cats love it. We clean ours and replace the filter every 2 or 3 weeks. We only use spring water in it and add water to it every day so the water level doesn't get very low. Best fountain for our cats!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Elderly cat approved.
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it. Unlike the previous plastic waterfall fountain, the water doesn't eventually splash out which required putting it into a small tub. Easily taken apart and thrown in the dish washer, as opposed to wrenching apart many plastic parts that feel like they may snap and break apart. Cat tongues are scratchy and will eventually wear out that plastic like fine sandpaper... not this fountain. Hard to tell the water level so I dropped a ping-pong ball in the reservoir to gauge it at a glance.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Ray Bessa

customer_reviews.title: Best design for your cat's health (and your mental health)
customer_reviews.text: Cats' instinct tells them running water is clean, and still water may not be, which is why a water fountain is great for cats. This fountain design is much superior to the ones with plastic bodies, because it is so much easier to clean. Even cats with the most refined table manners will get food and fur in their water bowl. Unlike the plastic ones, this fountain has no nooks or crannies in which bacteria can hide, and everything except the tiny pump can go in the dishwasher. The pump has a volume lever, so you can adjust how forcefully water is pumped, based on your cat's comfort level. It's well worth the difference in price over the plastic models.
customer_reviews.author: LeeFloyd

customer_reviews.title: second one we've had
customer_reviews.text: The first Pioneer Raindrop fountain lasted about 6 years! I was glad to replace it with the same model. The cat likes it because the water doesn't splash, just bubbles. It's easy to clean. I just empty it and refill it twice a day because the cat gets food debris in it (cat has few teeth). Cleaning the motor is a 7 minute task once a week. I am pleased with the useful life of this product, and the cat likes the fountain. We had tried several others before these, but he didn't like them and would not drink from them. This one suits him.
customer_reviews.author: Janet C

customer_reviews.title: Still a winner
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of the same fountain I have purchased, and remain very happy with this model. It is easy to get set up, as well as to change out the filter & clean. A big plus is the noise level-- it's virtually unnoticeable, unless you let the water level get low. Both my cats enjoy drinking from it a lot, and the fact that it has a nice basin area is nice for cats who don't want to stick their face into a stream of water to drink.
customer_reviews.author: Corrie

customer_reviews.title: Bad motor :(
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it! I wanted to. I have gone through 2 in 2 months. First one came, worked GREAT! Then all of a sudden, as with so many of these, the motor just stopped. I cleaned everything out, lined everything up, nothing. I returned, got a replacement, plugged it in, everything was great for like a week, then the motor just stopped. I tinkered with it, it worked again. Just stopped again, now it works again but, it is SOOOOOO loud. The first one made practically no noise. So disappointed. It really was a perfect fountain. Why do these motors have to be So poorly made?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Cat Water Fountain
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these fountains. My cats LOVE them. They are durable, easy to clean, and if the device is cleaned regularly, the pump lasts a long time. I’ve had one of these fountains for 4 years and I just purchased another one to replace a failing plastic fountain. In the past, I’ve had several kinds of plastic fountains. All of the plastic fountains failed within one year. It was either a pump failure or a serious leak. Never again. This fountain is the real deal. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley K. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy it again-
customer_reviews.text: I love this cat fountain because it is clean ,quiet,and my cat enjoys it-It’s pretty easy to clean but getting it all back together perfectly is a real pain -The whole process a is aggravating but the pros outweigh the cons on it so I would buy it again-I have replaced the motor once in five years so I can’t complain too much:)I bought the stainless steel design and it looks nice in the kitchen -
customer_reviews.author: jwr

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old plastic water fountain because of problems with mildew. It smells a bit plastic-y when you first unbox it but it goes away once you rinse everything off. I have it set to high because the low setting didn't create enough water flow in my opinion. It makes a bit of noise for the first 2 minutes but then it goes silent. My cats were a bit skeptical because of the initial noise and just sniffed around it for a few minutes but they weren't terrified so I expect they will definitely use it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Looks Good Doing It!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this fountain! I previously had a gravity fill water bowl that would get slimy within a week and had to be cleaned constantly...then I discovered that it was not dishwasher safe (oops!) and it melted. This time I wanted to find something that had moving water to try and combat the slimy sitting water. This is perfect! Not only does it solve that problem, but it looks nice while it is doing it. There is a slight noise with the pump/running water but after a few hours, it just turns into a nice background white noise sound. It was easy to put together and so far our dog loves it so overall a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Not good for more than one small animal
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this was stainless, and had decent reviews. What I HATE about it, is that it doesn't have any margin for water level AT ALL. You fill it, it's great, one dog drinks from it, and it instantly starts vibrating and sucking water loudly. These are a GIANT pain in the butt to disassemble, rinse and refill every day. I switched from the plastic Drinkwell fountain with a reserve tank because I wanted to reduce bacteria and have easier to clean parts - this is only worthwhile if you have ONE very small animal using it, and it is plugged in right next to the sink so it's easy to unplug and deal with daily.
customer_reviews.author: MnFosterMama

customer_reviews.title: Hard to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: My cats seem to really like this fountain but it’s been a total pain for me. I clean it out once a week and give it a full scrub and filter change monthly but it’s still really gross. It’s nearly impossible to get fully clean with all of the small ridges in the motor compartment. I clean it then fill it several times before the water doesn’t have crap floating around in it. Today I just held the motor under running water and shook it and I couldn’t believe how much black slime was coming out of it. I will definitely be replacing this fountain. So disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: LisaLovesShoes!

customer_reviews.title: Pump does not work
customer_reviews.text: I just received this Pioneer Stainless Steel Fountain today. I did a lot of research for a new foundation as the last 4 that I owned were plastic and also from a good brand name company, got slimey inside the bowl and the pump stopped working within 60 days. Well, as soon as I turned this one on, the pump hummed but that’s it. No circulation of water and the little fountain doesn’t work either. The water is completely filled so that’s not the problem. Really disappointed. I guess I’ll have to buy a replacement pump for an additional $20. This really sucks. I’m not a happy customer!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave my cat chin acne
customer_reviews.text: If this fountain were actually stainless steel, and it had a filter, it shouldn't be giving my cat chin acne, but it is. She has had a true stainless steel bowl that we wash every few days and been fine. Now with the addition of a water filter and this supposed "stainless steel" frame she is getting chin acne? Something's fishy. We threw it in the trash and it has been at least two weeks trying to heal our cat's chin acne with a spray under her chin and she hates it. Oh but she liked the flowing water. I guess she'll have to drink still for awhile until we find something of appropriate quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bednarz

customer_reviews.title: Filters ehh
customer_reviews.text: I do like that the fountains are stainless steel and not plastic. I have a cat that has issues with plastic. However the filters on this put so much drag, that it slows circulation. I found because of that, the walls of the fountain get slimy quickly. I have been running it without filters for a while now, and it's MUCH better. I'm not trying to filter out harmful things here, my cats just like clean circulating water with movement. By removing the filter, the bowl doesn't get slimy anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Mudsow

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this.
customer_reviews.text: The price was good. It was hard to put together the suction cups did not want to hold the filter box in place so it was off set and the water did not properly flow up the water fall. You have to take the whole fountain apart to clean it. I have bought 2 of these and they both had issues. Definitely will not buy again,
customer_reviews.author: Ondrea Allison

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad. My cat just didn't care.
customer_reviews.text: Cats like running water. Apparently, not from something that creates a soft, mechanical "hum". Since I took away his other sources he had no choice, but it's clear he couldn't care less. Leave the faucet dripping, he'll drink. Had a narrow-topped coffee cup, he love that. This... nope. And for his lack of interest the amount of work (not really that much) to clean it just isn't worth it... going back to the coffee cup.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Neiman

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The vibration is often quite noticeable, but sometimes it runs more quietly. I put kitchen grade sealant around the rim of the top steel piece to isolate it from the steel bowl, but the pump itself has a vibration. Sometimes I leave the top piece off altogether. I don't use the filter because I would always have to be replacing it. I just run the non-pump pieces through the dishwasher, rinse the pump vigorously by hand, and pour a little alcohol in the pump to sanitize while the rest of it is washing. My cats accept it, but don't prefer it to still water.
customer_reviews.author: mary30028

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it,  just doesn't last long with hard water...
customer_reviews.text: The caddy's live this product. Out.t needs cleaned at least weekly. There are nooks on the pump that need cleaned, so have tiny brushes for this. I have a lot of scale in my water, so the pump is having issues 6mo after purchase. If my water wasn't what out.t is, It would work better for my needs. Adjustable flow on the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley Dub

customer_reviews.title: my cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: Its not too bad to wash. Don't use anything harsh to scrub it or you will scratch it. The only concern I have is that the pumps cord bends at a 90 deg angle and I worry over time that it will pull and start to become dangerous. However I check it every week when I clean it to make sure there is no exposed wire. I would love to buy the ceramic one if they ever have it available. But it looks great, filters great, and isnt too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Dissappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in anticipation of being able to use it while on vacation. As the item was sold as new, I did not think I would have a problem. I have purchased this fountain twice in the past without issue. Fast forward one month, I open the box, set up the fountain and guess what?! THE PUMP DOES NOT WORK! I am beyond disappointed. I guess the lesson is next time I purchase a fountain open it immediately. At least I'm still within the return period.
customer_reviews.author: TallGirlSpark

customer_reviews.title: Very nice if you dont mind the extra work.
customer_reviews.text: Great bowl, cat loves it. Pain in the ass to clean, entire bowl must be disassembled and thoroughly scrubbed atleast once a week. and the pump must be taken apart completely and scrubbed out or it will malfunction. The plug fell out of the wall about 6 inches and broke so i had to buy a new one which sucked. The DIY mods other users talk about would probably make this product great but also add more work to an already work intensive product Really unless your pet wont drink without running water a regular easy to clean bowl is better and easier but i still like it. Looks like an upcycled bed pan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our water obsessed cats really love this thing...and they’ve stopped wanting water from the sink. Makes a low hum, so be sure you have a spot where that won’t bother you. And the stainless steel makes me comfortable it’s clean water. Does require a clean out every couple of weeks. Takes about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: UpStateNYGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The cats love it. Easier to clean than plastic fountains, and no concern about cats getting a reaction from rubbing against the metal (as they might with plastic). Charcoal filter is expensive, but the filter housing can be taken apart, the charcoal dumped, and new charcoal added. I purchased drinking water charcoal so that I can change out the filter's charcoal at much less expense. The filter liner can be soaked in vinegar and/or washed in soapy water and then rinsed thoroughly and replaced prior to adding new charcoal. Just be very gentle with the liner and the plastic housing.
customer_reviews.author: cbb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fountain
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my elderly cat to encourage her to drink water after she was diagnosed with some kidney functionality issues. It's great, no complaints. It looks nice and it's easy to set up. It's a little annoying to clean, but from my experience most water fountains are. It's fairly quiet; I live in a small apartment and it's in the front room and I can't really hear it running from my living room or my bedroom. Seems to be running fine, but I've only had it for about a week. But so far, no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: White, milky water?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my spoiled cat for the same reason that a lot of people did - my cat loves running water. She loves it so far and she's been drinking out of it, but I do have a few complaints. This morning when I woke up the water was all clouded and milky. I'm not sure why/how this happened, but I just cleaned it out and refilled it, and if it happens again I will be returning it. No one else seems to have had this problem, though, so I'm hoping it doesn't happen again. I'm still giving it three stars because other than that I've had no problems with it. Will update if it happens again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I want to love this but.......
customer_reviews.text: I love this, I really do. It's quiet and my cats love it. BUT THE ELECTRICAL DESIGN HAS SERIOUS FLAWS. The pump electrical cord wraps tightly around the pump mechanism/case, it doesn't have strain relief and I am afraid it will eventually fray and expose the wiring. And you know metal, water, and electricity don't mix.
customer_reviews.author: J. Purnell

customer_reviews.title: Probably not better than the standard bowl you already have.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of hard to assemble and a bit awkward once it's in use. My cats were both obsessed with drinking from the faucet to the point of tipping their water bowls over so that they would force me to turn on the sink... I thought this would help. It's pretty and it's quiet, but my cats are extremely skeptical. I'm going to keep it but I'm not sure it's worth all the bells and whistles -- although, it is nice to have a little fountain in the kitchen that the cats can't knock over.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works well, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great product: sleek design, well-made, and my kittens love it. I had an issue where the motor stopped working and their customer service got back to me right away and I was able to fix it (they said if I couldn't, they'd send me a new one as it was still under warranty). I will warn that I recommended this to my dad for his cat, and the poor thing is terrified of it (despite his love of drinking from sinks), so it's not for every cat.
customer_reviews.author: Kolbe Moss

customer_reviews.title: Most Recommended. Cat Loves It.
customer_reviews.text: Stainless steel is the way to go. Plastic bowls will give your cat those black little bumps on their chins, akin to acne. I love how the cat has three options; the burbling coming out, the slide of water going into the bowl, and the bowl itself. My cat dove right on in after I told him the noise would not hurt him. He prefers bubbling water, but I have also seen him drink out of the water slide. He has never drunk out of the bowl. It is a little noisy but not enough to make the cat shy away. A low humming, is what it sounds like.
customer_reviews.author: Newportgomes

customer_reviews.title: Instructions difficult to follow.
customer_reviews.text: The setup instructions were quite vague. I had a difficult time trying to figure everything out and where to position it. Particularly the pump and the "Egg" thing which hold the pump and filter. I was hoping to minimize the amount of plastic in it. My last fountain was completely plastic and the quality deteriorated quite a bit after a while, making it harder to clean. We'll see how this goes.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Quiet motor but unsecured top
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fountain for 3 years now. It works well if no cat plays or toys with it, but we have some younger cats who love to shove the top around and knock it off. Lately I find the top askew or on the floor more than in place and producing the lovely bubbling little fountain that should always run. It's very quiet and unless cats mess with it, it works well. I give it a 3-star rating because I think it would be improved by having a locking mechanism for the top cover (like crockpots have for locking lids in place).
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, pump is crap skip this!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog who is very sloppy and gets her water filthy very quickly. I got this in hopes to help keep her water cleaner. It’s a complete waste of money. The pump is not powerful enough to pull water through filtration and out through the top. It leaves a ton of sediment in her bowl. I followed all directions, watched YouTube video, made sure all holes and ports were aligned but it doesn’t work for crap. I’ve thought of buying a different pump but the housing makes that more complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Karin L. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. Our cat took right to it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Our cat took right to it. We had a different fountain that was plastic and there is no comparison. It's so easy to clean by just putting it all in the dishwasher (except for the pump of course). The stainless doesn't let algae grow on it. The plastic shell that the pump sits in will still grow algae but still doesn't compare to other plastic fountains. If the water level gets too low it will start to make a loud gurgling noise. Also, sometimes water will track down the power cord where it exits the bowl for some reason. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Webb

customer_reviews.title: but the cats LOVE IT. they drink at the same time
customer_reviews.text: I thought, I'd be cheap and buy the plastic cat fountain with the flower. I had it for 4 months and my cats used it only to clean their feet. I ordered this raindrop design as a replacement, and what can I say? Not only is it dishwasher safe, but the cats LOVE IT. they drink at the same time, one prefers the side without motion and the other loves the flow of the water. they seem to enjoy drinking from this as they take their time and seem to drink quite a bit of water. I've been filing it up every other day with fresh water and its always low.
customer_reviews.author: the

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this. One likes to drink from the bubble, one from the stream, and one from the bowl. As long as you take it apart to clean it once every two weeks or so it will run great. I took a star off just because it’s a little hard to take apart with the parts you have to line up and manipulating the cord. But, compared to the other fountains I’ve had it’s way easier. It does have a little hum, but it’s not too loud or annoying to me.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Despite following care instructions, the pump motor fails.
customer_reviews.text: Despite being cared for and operated as specified in the instructions, the pump motor failed after less than 2 months of use. Very disappointing, doubly so because PetCo is unable to replace parts, would not issue a replacement, and would only issue a partial refund. This is ultimately an expensive water bowl. *Update* PetCo did send a replacement, and the pump motor failed after less than a week on the replacement. It's a shame, because the pets did like it while it worked, but clearly the pump motor is a point of failure.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and the cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a cat and a kitten 2 years ago and neither one of them was drinking much water, and even then their preferred vessel was the bathroom faucet, which was hardly ideal! A friend suggested moving their bowl to the bathroom, which helped, but they still preferred the faucet. I bought this fountain and they love it and are finally drinking water on a regular basis. The kitten (now a cat) even has fun pawing at the water once in a while. It's super easy to clean and the filters are easy to replace (I change them every other week).
customer_reviews.author: S. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several of these Pioneer Raindrops over the years. Enough water is very important to cat health, and I like that this unit is stainless steel and doesn't absorb bacteria. Two major pieces plus the pump and pump housing. The pump is easy to take apart and clean, the housing is two pieces that cleanup well with a stiff brush (or toothbrush). The filters need to be changed a couple of times a month, especially if you have a cat that likes to drop food in the water bowl. The pump is quiet. The active water flow seems to help my cat drink more.
customer_reviews.author: Dubliner

customer_reviews.title: NO KIDNEY DISEASE IN THIS HOUSE
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pioneer pet fountain. The first one was rather large and I was pleased that the new one was a more compact design. I love this fountain--easy to clean (dishwasher) and put back together. I change my filter every 2 weeks, but that is just me. I just feel better doing that with 3 cats. Also, in order to stave off kidney disease, I feed my children FRESHPET in the case and add lots of water to the bowl. As I mentioned, we do everything possible to keep that urinary tract disease free. And, finally, dry cat food is not healthy for cats and I learned that the hard way. Meow to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your car isn't afraid of shinny fountains
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy to clean it is, it's not very noisy, yet the spout for the pump could be longer and it takes a while to align the clam shell to the top cover. Just a bit of warning, I had to take the steel back and replace it with the ceramic fountain because my cat was afraid of it. She loves the ceramic version now which is fine. Just keep in mind that the clam cover for the filter doesn't close as well as the steel's clam cover. It becomes a pain when that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Kamy Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great till it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I should of written this when it stopped working last week. Everything seem great until it stopped working. The pump just gave up. It still runs but not with enough pressure to get it going anymore. I watched video and took the pump apart and cleaned it but to no avail. So I can't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Catlover

customer_reviews.title: Pump stopped working after 7 months of 24/7 use
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Upon closer inspection it seems the motor was seized as a result of cat hair becoming lodged within the pump. While wet it is easy to remove with tweezers and now the pump works well again! Purchased this on 8/26/15. Currently 3/14/16 About 7 months later the pump motor no longer whirrs. Nothing is perfect or permanent. I'll contact the company and then update my review to see if I have a beat ass, expensive stainless water bowl at this point, or if I get to change this to a 5-star review and add details about exemplary customer service and warranty policy! Motors die. Lets see if this company is worth their salt.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Half an Hour
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea, being stainless, but it only worked for 30 minutes then stopped pumping. The pump ran but nothing came out anymore. Also the top part just sits on the base, so my cats were constantly knocking it off. Shame, I wanted to like this as all the others available are plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Captain B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, works great, very quiet, worth every penny, cheaper than any local store.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a little sturdier, but that might defeat the functionality. Amazing product. My old cat loves the running water. I also have two kittens i fostered who are now permanent, we bottle fed from a very young age and I guess momma kitty maybe show their babes how to drink because these two did not have that training and seemed almost scared of the bowl. At almost 9 months they still slap the bowl and knock it over before drinking!! This remedied that, they love the trickle and drink from the spigot. 100 stars.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it when the pump doesn't even last a year.
customer_reviews.text: It's great when the pump worked. Water pump lasted about 9 months. Both of my chicken cats got use to it after about a week. Now they only drink from this fountain. A new pump is about half the cost of the fountain. Says the pump has a 1 year warranty but no idea how to get a warranty replacement. For this amount of money it should at least last a year. I would look at other options not because your cats won't drink from it but because the pump quality should be better for the overall cost.
customer_reviews.author: M2AZ

customer_reviews.title: Cats loved it! Until they killed it.
customer_reviews.text: My cas are obsessed with water so they splashed the water a lot and the water level would get low quickly. I'd do my best to fill it as soon as I noticed, but after a year of this, the motor died. It gets nicks easily and then they rust forever more. It's a pain to clean as well. It has to be done weekly or slim will build up. I hated adding it to my long list of weekend chores. Not honestly sad that it's dead. I'm perfectly fine using a normal cat bowl from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Phenyx

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel is great, but you will probably have to replace the plastic parts every year or two
customer_reviews.text: The stainless steel is easy to clean. After 3 years I had to replace the plastic pump housing because the tiny suction cups that hold it in place had broken. I have also replaced the pump once in 3.5 years. I consider both reasonable over that length of time. The only complaint I have about the design is there are too many tiny areas on the pump for gunk to build up. I use a toothpick and cotton swab once a week to try to get into the corners and along the groove of the power cord. Replacement parts, if not available on Amazon, can be purchased from the Pioneer Pet website.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cooksey

customer_reviews.title: Great for fresh moving water
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves drinking moving water. It seems nice and clean because it is metal. It does get really slimy along the edges after a month, so I take it apart, clean it thoroughly and change the filter. It will hum loudly if the water level gets too low. It is plenty big enough for a cat or probably a small dog, but maybe not for a large dog, I don't know, I don't have a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for our cats
customer_reviews.text: Of what's available on Amazon, this is the best choice for anyone with a small dog or cats. It's nearly silent and is relatively easy to setup and keep clean. For those that say this fountain is noisy, they need to make sure the pump is primed (air is purged) when they setup their fountain for the first time. I have zero complaints, this fountain is everything I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Dave from GA

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months - AFTER the return window.
customer_reviews.text: For $45, I had the expectation that this would last awhile. Despite weekly cleaning (including taking the pump apart to clean inside, as the video shows) and using softened water.... it just stopped working. Disappointed. On the plus side, it was very quiet when it actually worked.
customer_reviews.author: psycholinguist

customer_reviews.title: No more faucet water for demanding cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats were immediately attracted to this, even before I had it set up, and they love it. No more turning the faucets on for pleading kitties. I had to get them used to my not responding at all when they begged, and I'd just stick an ice cube in this fountain instead, and they responded well to the change. This is a photo of their use after about 10 minutes. They were drinking from it within moments of setting it down, even before it was on. I waited until they had had a sip before activating so as not to startle them.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My Bengal cats love it. They are super picky about water in a bowl it has to be moving for them to touch it. This filters it and keeps it moving so two birds.. one stone. This is also our second one. We have two in the house, one upstairs one downstairs. I have three cats so they all love it!
customer_reviews.author: 3 AM Art Productions

customer_reviews.title: Great water fountain, but comes with crap inverter.
customer_reviews.text: I love the water fountain, however the inverter is crap. It started making a terrible buzzing noise and it would feel warm in less than 24 hours of use. We bought an inverter from somewhere else and connected that to the water pump instead and it works great now. If you buy this, just be prepared to spend a couple extra dollars on a new inverter. Other than that it's been working great, be sure to fill it with enough water otherwise air will get into the water pump and it will spit water and make noises. Easy to clean, looks nice, keeps the water clean with the filter, and the kitty seems to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive pet water bowl & is very quiet. You have the option on the little motor to adjust how fast the flow of water is & therefore you can control the noise level. I do hate the chore of cleaning it, but it has to be done & isn't that hard to do. Just be sure to find & buy the filters in large quantities for some savings.
customer_reviews.author: K Martin

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Glad I tried this fountain after being unhappy with a ceramic one. Stainless is much lighter and easier to change water. I change water everyday to keep it clean and so I don’t need a filter cartridge. My cat is drinking more. Going to try to modify it to have a silicone tube going from pump out the top to eliminate the white plastic pump/filter holder.
customer_reviews.author: P. L.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this for my cat because a friend of ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my cat because a friend of mine has one and loves it. I expected the box to be damaged because that is all that was listed wrong with it in the condition notes, but when i opened the box i found that It reaked of rubbing alcohol and one of the internal plastic fountain components was burned and warped so badly they didnt even fit together. There is no way i am risking burning my house down or electricuting my pet by keeping and using this. Returned immediately. If this had been listed in the used conditions i never would have ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Michal

customer_reviews.title: Good for 3 weeks...
customer_reviews.text: My cats really like the flowing water. It's a bit louder than I'd like. Well actually, it's completely silent now, because the pump broke after only 3 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Don'tbefooled

customer_reviews.title: so we need to top off the fountain every morning to make sure it's not running too low (they love this thing and drink from it constantly)
customer_reviews.text: Silent perfection. We have two cats, so we need to top off the fountain every morning to make sure it's not running too low (they love this thing and drink from it constantly). Cleaning it is super easy, too. We had some issues with the Drinkwell Zen fountain (the motor made insane noises, and the replacement motor did the same thing), and I remember plugging this in and being shocked by how quiet it is. You can barely hear it running if you're right next to it. The 'waterfall' is also very quiet, though, so if your animal needs the sound of trickling water, this might not be the right choice for you, but it was perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine D

customer_reviews.title: Easier to clean than others, with similar issues. ...
customer_reviews.text: Easier to clean than others, with similar issues. The unit develops biofilms that are very difficult to remove. I can put the individual units in the dishwasher to clean them, but efforts to keep slime out of the pump, and thus my very picky cat's mouth, have failed. I can buy new carbon filters, but the slime in the pump will always be an issue. I have tried soaking the pump in vinegar, and soaking the pump in bleach (of course rinsing very thoroughly before restoring the assembly). My cat is very picky...and so far, she shuns it.
customer_reviews.author: Karl J. Himebaugh

customer_reviews.title: Thirsty Cat
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. The pump is already burnt out. It does look nice but for 15 or twenty dollars you can purchase a nice looking dish without a pump. It scared the cat for the first week. And it needs cleaning a lot. Don't throw you money down the drain. Get a regular water dish. I paid 35 dollars for this. I did get free shipping. That will help me absorb some of the cost of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Dude

customer_reviews.title: My cat uses this fancy water bowl
customer_reviews.text: To my surprise, the cat likes this water bowl. Works as advertised. Nice stainless. Pump resonates in the bowl and causes a little bit of white noise in the room, but it is not intrusive. Does he drink from the toilet less now? Yeah, I think so. Update: You have to disassemble and clean the pump weekly to keep things fresh. It is a little fountain/aquarium pump. So if you are used to those you know exactly what to do. I just put the bowl and pump house in the dishwasher , but the pump needs to be cleaned by hand. Q-tip is my weapon of choice there.
customer_reviews.author: MWH

customer_reviews.title: Clean pump!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of those fountains in different part of the world and my cats love it. Easy to clean if you do it regularly. So far you can find filters only on Amazon .Petco stopped selling them for about a year.Be aware of cleaning pump as well as changing filter every 2 weeks. If you let it go for longer your animals would refuse to drink out of it. While cleaning,take pump out and take it a part.Clean inside of the pump with brush,make sure you get every inside corner of it . It's disgusting inside after 2 weeks. I wish manufacturer add video on how to clean it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Yelena Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, holds a lot of water
customer_reviews.text: I brought this after one of my cats developed a bad skin infection/cat acne from his previous water dish. My vet said to switch to stainless steel as it doesn't collect bacteria. I was a little nervous due to the open nature of the water reserve because my cats like to play in water and knock over fountains. My cats love it! It holds a lot of water so I don't have to refill often, and it is so quiet (unless the water level gets low). Also very easy to clean. My two big boys (about 18lbs each) drink so much more water now!
customer_reviews.author: omghealz

customer_reviews.title: The stainless steel scratches very easily when cleaning
customer_reviews.text: This fountain is okay in the beginning. Definetly does not get the stream in the picture. The humming of the fountain makes more noise than the water trickling and it's a very, very tiny, trickle. This fountain also evaporates quickly, so be prepared to change frequently or it will make the most god-awful noise when water isn't running through the fountain. The stainless steel scratches very easily when cleaning. It's for cats, so I know that doens't matter, but it just makes the fountain appear dingy/unclean. Additionally, hard water deposits build up(even though I used filtered water and there is a filter on this fountain) and have ruined portions of the stainless steel. Wish I had bought the plastic one.
customer_reviews.author: JoeysDad

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Fountain
customer_reviews.text: The pump is quiet. Only hear a slight humming sound when standing VERY close to it. Water bubbles up quietly. Took 2 cats 2 days to get used to it. Taking advice from another reviewer, did not plug it in the first day in order for them to get used to it. The cats drank from it just fine after it was plugged in the 2nd day. Easy to assemble and clean. They both are drinking from the bowl but are "studying" the other 2 options to drink from. A friend of mine had purchased one and both her cat and small dog drink from it.
customer_reviews.author: juliechi

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect Product for Drinking Water
customer_reviews.text: We have enjoyed the raindrop for several years. 3 of our 4 cats drink from it. I use filtered water so there's little mineral buildup. Clean it often but until today when it stopped functioning didn't know the pump could be taken apart. Watched the youtube video and went to work. Once I cleaned all parts of the pump and put it back together it began functioning like new. I'd already prepared an order for a new one but then read the suggestions about cleaning the pump. Grateful for that. I want our cats to eat and drink from stainless steel. Too much product is coming from China. I'd never purchase food from that country either.
customer_reviews.author: emd5542

customer_reviews.title: BEST fountain ever. Easy cleaning and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Could not recommend this fountain more. I used to use the Drinkwell plastic fountain but it was SUCH a pain to clean. This is so easy and quiet. It does get noisy when not filled up all the way but even with two cats, I don't have to refill it as often as I had to fill the Drinkwell fountain. I also notice the stainless steel does NOT collect all that gross hair and dust as much as the plastic fountains do. And my cat likes drinking either from the bubbling top or from the bowl equally.
customer_reviews.author: RedRabbit

product_meta.title: Pioneer Pet Raindrop Fountain, Pet Drinking Fountains
product_meta.description:
Size:60 oz.| Color:Stainless SteelPioneer Pet Raindrop Stainless Steel Pet Drinking FountainPet fountains help your animals to drink more water because they are attracted to moving water. Now finally there is a stainless steel pet drinking fountain that looks like it belongs in your kitchen. Our stainless steel drinking fountain is extremely easy to take apart and clean. There has never been a pet fountain that looks or works as well as this one does. Circulating drinking water is naturally appealing to your pet and will attract your pet to the fountain. Ultra quiet pump circulates and oxygentates the water while the filter cleans and purifies the water. One filter is included with the fountain and each filter typcially lasts about 30 days (replacement filters are sold separately). The dishwasher safe, stainless steel construction allows for easy, hassle free cleaning. The 7.3 foot long cord easily disconnects for easy cord removal for cleaning. The large capacity reduces the number of times you need to refill each day making your life easier. Customers need to clean their pumps to keep it working . In the manual it states that the customer needs to clean the pump once a month to keep it working properly. 1 year warranty on the pumps to replace any defective items. Using stainless steel bowls help to protect your pets from bacterial infection

AMAZON.COM







DRINKING FOUNTAIN RAINDROP™ BY PIONEER PET
Moving water attracts pets, encouraging them to drink to stay hydrated & healthy. The ultra-quiet pump circulates and oxygenates the water. With the elegant shape & sparkling stainless steel, this pet fountain will go with any décor in your home. There has never been a pet fountain that looks or works as well as this one does.



Winner of the 2010 Editors’ Choice Award, Pet Product News International. PRODUCT FEATURES & BENEFITS
 * Water flow continuously washes the bowl for maximum cleanliness.
 * Premium Stainless Steel.
 * Capacity: 60 oz. (1.77L)
 * Product Dimensions: 4 ¼”H x 9 ¾”W x 11 ¾” L
 * Product Weight: 1.7 lbs.
 * Premium replaceable charcoal filter for clean & pure, healthy water.
 * Patent pending design holds filter and electric pump.
 * Safe, low voltage UL listed power system.
 * 6’(1.82m) long power cord.
feature_bullets: Circulating drinking water is naturally appealing to your pet
Replaceable raindrop charcoal filter (#3002) for clean and pure, healthy water
Dishwasher safe, stainless steel construction allows for easy cleaning
Modern rain drop shape compliments décor of any room
For optimal performance we recommend that you clean the fountain once a week and disassemble/clean the pump once a month
